page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: HOUSING. Most people in the area own their own homes;the majority of those who have been living in council houses are now buying them.New houses built in the area during the last twelve years have been high quality executive type houses.There are no flats and few bungalows.Owing to the high cost of land,and the popularity of the area, houses are extremely expensive and rates are high. Older-type houses,some of them former farm labourers cottages,are sought after by people who wish to modernise and even enlarge them while living in them. Planning permission for building new houses is difficult to come by because the area falls in the Green Belt,where intensity of housing is kept low.No new council houses have been built.
